names.pinyin: wang shi qing shu yi qi tang
names.english: master wang's summerheat clearing qi boosting decoction
names.commonEnglish: Master Wang's Summerheat Clearing Qi Boosting Decoction

actions: Tonifies Qi, generates fluids, nurtures the Stomach, nourishes Yin, benefits Lung Yin and clears Fire from the Lungs.
With Shi Hu, Mai Men Dong and Zhi Mu, for a high fever, thirst, diarrhea and dehydration associated with Warm-Heat pathogen disease in which both the Qi and Fluids have been injured.
Nourishes Yin, clears Heat, generates fluids, enriches Kidney Yin, reduces Heat from Deficiency and nourishes Stomach and Lung Yin.
Moistens the Lungs, nourishes Yin, stops coughing, nourishes Stomach Yin, generates Fluids, clears the Heart and eliminates irritability.
Clears Heat, drains Dampness, drains Fire, resolves Fire toxicity and drains Stomach Fire.
Clears Heat, relieves irritability, generates Body Fluids and promotes urination.
With Zhi Mu and Mai Men Dong, for Heat Attacking the Heart with irritability
Descends Qi and eases the Middle.
Clears Heat and drains Fire from the Qi Stage, Lungs and Stomach, nourishes Yin, moistens Dryness, generates Fluids, clears Deficiency Fire and quenches thirst.
With Huang Lian, for Blazing Stomach Fire with intense hunger, dry stools, dry, yellow tongue coat and a slippery rapid pulse.
Moistens the Lungs, resolves Phlegm, stops coughing, moderates and harmonizes the harsh properties of other herbs and guides the herbs to all twelve channels.
Tonifies the Qi of the Lungs, Spleen and Intestines, stops restlessness, stops thirst and generates fluids.

syndromes: Wei Stage: Summerheat Injuring the Qi and Fluids

modifications.purpose: strong thirst, a flushed face and a high fever
severe injury to the Qi and Fluids
